definition: to toss and turn (sleeplessly)/again and again
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: That night, the boy couldn’t sleep for disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，小男孩失望极了，翻来覆去怎么也睡不着。

sentences.english: He tossed fretfully and could not get to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 但是东想西想，急躁地翻来覆去终夜不能入眠。

sentences.english: I tossed and turned all ngiht.
And certainly don't ruminate on your own.
sentences.chinese: 当然你不要自个把事情翻来覆去地想个不停。

sentences.english: I listened, and tossed about, and, finally, dressed and descended.
sentences.chinese: 我谛听着，翻来覆去，终于穿上衣服下了楼。

sentences.english: I’ve been turning over these questions in my head for the past two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 近两周来我一直在翻来覆去地思考这两个问题。

sentences.english: as you read and turn the thin message in your hands.
sentences.chinese: 阅读信上的字句，一张薄纸在手中翻来覆去。

sentences.english: I tossed and turned all night.
Tossed and turned at night, the prince is still can not sleep, Wu Guanzhi dont understand the idea.
sentences.chinese: 夜里，王子尚翻来覆去睡不着，吴冠志却不懂其想法。

sentences.english: She tossed restlessly in her sleep.
It just gave me more time to toss and turn.
sentences.chinese: 这恰好给我更多的时间翻来覆去。

sentences.english: The patient lashed about in great pain.
sentences.chinese: 患者翻来覆去，痛苦难耐。

sentences.english: Some refrains occur over and over in my e-mail, no matter what the year.
sentences.chinese: 年成无论好坏，我电邮里总有些翻来覆去的提问。

definition: to harp on/over and over/merely ring changes on a few terms
to toss and turn restlessly (in the bed)
over and over
repeatedly/time and time again
in a daze/bewildered
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to fall asleep
to fail to grasp the main points
the whole night/all through the night
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
repeatedly/back and forth again and again
dizzy
to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
whining/groaning/muttering
(coll.) a long time
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
